meanings.definition: The action or state of forcing or being forced to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her compulsion to clean the house every day was strong.
meanings.sent2: His compulsion to check his phone constantly was becoming a problem.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's compulsion to organize her bookshelf by color made her friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The compulsion to always be right was like a heavy weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The compulsion to eat the last cookie was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: An irresistible urge to behave in a certain way.
meanings.sent1: The compulsion to help others was deeply ingrained in her.
meanings.sent2: His compulsion to tap his foot when nervous was noticeable to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The compulsion to sing loudly in the shower was a daily occurrence.
meanings.sent4: Her compulsion to buy every cute mug she saw was like an addiction.
meanings.sent5: The compulsion to jump in puddles was too tempting to resist.
